intro: Hieracium salebratum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium salebratum is often found in temperate regions and can be an indicator species for certain soil types.
